hu.kazocsaba.math.matrix

Interface Matrix

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Matrix2, Matrix3, Vector, Vector2, Vector3, Vector4
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImmutableMatrix, ImmutableMatrix2, ImmutableMatrix3, ImmutableVector, ImmutableVector2, ImmutableVector3, ImmutableVector4

    public interface Matrix
    A matrix of double values.
    Author:
    Kaz√≥ Csaba

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Adds each element of the argument to the corresponding element of this matrix.

      Computes the eigen decomposition of this matrix.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        double get(int row,
         int col)
        Retrieves an element of the matrix.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index
        col - the column index
        Returns:
        the element at the specified position
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if either index is out of range

      • getQuick

        double getQuick(int row,
              int col)
        Retrieves an element of the matrix without checking the arguments. If the row or the column index is invalid, the behaviour of this method is unspecified. For example, it may return some value or throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index
        col - the column index
        Returns:
        the element at the specified position

      • set

        void set(int row,
       int col,
       double value)
        Updates an element of the matrix.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index
        col - the column index
        value - the new value
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if either index is out of range

      • setQuick

        void setQuick(int row,
            int col,
            double value)
        Updates an element of the matrix without checking the indexes. If the row or the column index is invalid, the behaviour of this method is unspecified. For example, it may set some element or throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index
        col - the column index
        value - the new value

      • mul

        Matrix mul(Matrix m)
        Multiplies this matrix with the argument and returns the result.
        Parameters:
        m - a matrix
        Returns:
        the product of the two matrices
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the matrix dimensions don't match (i.e. this.getColumnCount()!=m.getRowCount())
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • mul

        Vector mul(Vector v)
        Multiplies this matrix with the argument and returns the result.
        Parameters:
        v - a vector
        Returns:
        the product of this matrix and the vector
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the matrix dimensions don't match (i.e. this.getColumnCount()!=v.getDimension())
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • scale

        void scale(double c)
        Scales this matrix (in place) by a scalar by multiplying all matrix elements with c.
        Parameters:
        c - the scalar factor

      • add

        void add(Matrix m)
        Adds each element of the argument to the corresponding element of this matrix. (An in-place operation.)
        Parameters:
        m - the other matrix
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument has different dimensions than this matrix

      • subtract

        void subtract(Matrix m)
        Subtracts each element of the argument from the corresponding element of this matrix. (An in-place operation.)
        Parameters:
        m - the other matrix
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument has different dimensions than this matrix

      • times

        Matrix times(double c)
        Returns a new matrix which equals this matrix multiplied by a scalar.
        Parameters:
        c - the scalar factor
        Returns:
        a new matrix with the value this*c

      • plus

        Matrix plus(Matrix m)
        Returns a new matrix that is the sum of this matrix and the argument.
        Parameters:
        m - the other matrix
        Returns:
        the sum of this matrix and the argument
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument has different dimensions than this matrix

      • minus

        Matrix minus(Matrix m)
        Returns a new matrix that is the difference of this matrix and the argument.
        Parameters:
        m - the other matrix
        Returns:
        the difference of this matrix and the argument
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument has different dimensions than this matrix

      • getSubmatrix

        Matrix getSubmatrix(int row1,
                  int row2,
                  int col1,
                  int col2)
        Returns a new matrix that is a submatrix of this one. The result will be a matrix with row2-row1+1 rows and col2-col1+1 columns, and will be initialized with the corresponding values from this matrix.
        Parameters:
        row1 - the first row of the submatrix
        row2 - the last row of the submatrix
        col1 - the first column of the submatrix
        col2 - the last column of the submatrix
        Returns:
        the submatrix
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments don't properly specify a submatrix

      • getSub

        SubmatrixAccessor getSub()
        Provides access to submatrices of this matrix. The accessor returned by this method provides submatrices with the same semantics as getSubmatrix(int, int, int, int): it creates new, independent, modifiable matrices initialized with the requested submatrix data. For example: 
         getSub().matrix3(0, 1)
        is equivalent to 
         (Matrix3) getSubmatrix(0, 2, 1, 3)
        Returns:
        an accessor to the submatrices of this matrix

      • viewSub

        SubmatrixAccessor viewSub()
        Provides views to submatrices of this matrix. The matrices returned by methods of the accessor share data with this matrix.
        Returns:
        an accessor to submatrix views of this matrix

      • setSubmatrix

        void setSubmatrix(Matrix m,
                int row,
                int col)
        Sets a submatrix of the current matrix to match the argument. The submatrix position is identified by its top left element at (row, col).
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to copy elements from
        row - the row to copy the first row of m to
        col - the column to copy the first column of m to
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if m is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if row or col is negative or if row+m.getRowCount()>getRowCount() or row+m.getColumnCount()>getColumnCount() (i.e. the matrix m doesn't fit in the current matrix at the specified position)

      • inverse

        Matrix inverse()
               throws SingularityException
        Computes the inverse of this matrix.
        Returns:
        the inverse of this matrix
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this matrix is not square
        SingularityException - if this matrix is singular

      • pseudoInverse

        Matrix pseudoInverse()
        Computes the pseudo inverse of this matrix.
        Returns:
        the pseudo inverse of this matrix

      • transpose

        Matrix transpose()
        Returns the transpose of this matrix.
        Returns:
        the transpose

      • transposedView

        Matrix transposedView()
        Returns a view of the transpose of this matrix. The view returned by this method shares data with this matrix.
        Returns:
        a transposed view of this matrix

      • determinant

        double determinant()
        Returns the determinant of this matrix.
        Returns:
        the determinant
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this matrix is not square

      • norm

        double norm()
        Returns the 2-norm of this matrix.
        Returns:
        the 2-norm

      • error

        double error(Matrix m)
        Returns the 2-norm of the difference of this matrix and the argument. This norm is often used as an error measure between two matrices.
        Parameters:
        m - the other matrix
        Returns:
        this.minus(m).norm()
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument has different dimensions than this matrix

      • normalize

        void normalize()
        Scales this matrix by a scalar so that its 2-norm become 1. This method is equivalent to scale(1/norm()).

      • normalized

        Matrix normalized()
        Returns a matrix equal to this matrix scaled to unit 2-norm.
        Returns:
        times(1/norm())

      • svd

        SingularValueDecomposition svd()
        Computes the singular value decomposition of this matrix.
        Returns:
        the SVD of this matrix

      • eig

        EigenDecomposition eig()
        Computes the eigen decomposition of this matrix.
        Returns:
        the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of this matrix

      • equals

        boolean equals(Object o)
        Returns true if the argument is also a matrix and has the same dimensions and contents as this matrix. The matrix elements are compared with double equality without any tolerance.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        o - an object
        Returns:
        true if this matrix and the argument are equal, false otherwise
